title: I think Tryndamere has enough skins now
body:
There's quite a few champions who are in need of a new skin, Tryndamere has enough at this point.

I agree that some of these champions definitely need more skins! 

Diana is slated for the fire-themed skin from All Star, so you can look forward to that in the coming months! 

Nasus received Archduke last year, Shaco received Wild Card, Talon received SSW, and Jax recently received Warden, for a bit of context there.

Malzahar is on the Champion Update list, so we won't be considering him for a skin until he's squared away. 

I would love to see a Karthus skin with particles, personally. And now that Sion has been updated (and his model and rig are so fresh and so clean, clean), I'd love to give him a higher tier skin that has all kinds of bells and whistles. His catalog of skins doesn't have a whole lot going on, as compared to some of the newer champions. D:

While you make some good points I must ask, how is the Skin's picking order?

I see so many champions that get extremely loved skin-wise and others just...Are left there to sit on the dust. Going with the thread, Tryndamere is a main offender, and it's even worse because his kit, design and theme are extremely bland, even boring, so it kind of baffles me why he gets so many skins pumped out for him.

We pick skins in several different ways.

We go into an ideation saying, "We want a new skin for x champion" and we discuss potential thematics for that champion - Mecha, Arcade, or even new thematics we've never done. We discuss the hooks of these thematics and then we vote on which ones we think are strongest. Those are then further discussed to come up with what we think works the best. The other ideas are stored away and can be pulled out for future ideations! 

We go in saying, "Hey, it's almost time for Snowdown, let's talk about the thematic for this year, and who we think would be good champions to support it." Similar as before, but this time, we toss out champions and the hooks that would make the skin really cool and fit in with the event. Again, we vote and further discuss and other ideas not used are saved for later.

We go in saying, "Here's a thematic we want to pursue - Arcade." What champions work well here, and what's the hook that supports how awesome this idea. Same as before - we vote, discuss, and save all ideas for later.

We also take a look at fan creations in these meetings - both from a folder we keep, as well as doing a quick search on Google. They're also considered when we work on ideating on new content! 

That said, we do bring up champions who haven't had skins in a while, just to make sure they're on the radar, however, they may not be the right fit for a thematic we want to move forward with/event we're running with.

Do you ever think of a concept before trying to tie it to a champion?
Nightmare tryndamere for example (a really cool skin btw) strikes me as one where virtually any other sword wielding champion might have used the theme, and in fact I had to double check that it was in fact Tryndemere when I faced him ingame for the first time.

If able I'd also wish you'd comment on the state of the less humanoid champions.
Lissandra and Zac for example have a total of 3 skins, while both being from 2013, 2 of them being the default and arguably a colored reskin with minimal changes done to it, while for example Draven, who has a much simpler model has as much as 6.
Do you plan to release more skins for the champions with weirder models to have them match with the number of skins other champions have?

We sure do! 

For PROJECT, for example, we had already created PROJECT: Yasuo, and we thought more PROJECT skins would be cool, so we went into an ideation with the mindset of "Yasuo was awesome, who else would really work for this thematic?"

Unfortunately, I can't comment on what may or may not be in development for any of the skins content that hasn't been announced. 

We do plan to release skins for as many champions as possible. Last year, we released 100 skins for 93 champions, which is pretty solid, considering some champs weren't eligible for skins due to champion updates. 

While older champions will likely always have more skins than newer champions (Annie and Warwick, for example, who were two of the earliest champions - Annie being the first champion), we still want to make sure champions have several skins which fulfill all kinds of alternative fantasies.

The complexity of the model/champion won't stop us - it just may take us a bit longer to come up with a cool thematic that works well. In Lissandra's case, we need to accommodate her walk animations and come up with a cool base for her to stand on! But, if we have a cool thematic, the complexity of the champion won't stop us (not even Zyra~).

Talon is a champion from 2011, so like a lot of older champions, their earlier skins are mostly model and texture changes. Not using that as an excuse by any means - just how it used to be. That said, I'd love to see Talon with a bit more in terms of sounds, and even some particles. (He's pretty particle light - but I think there are a few places we could really add some flair.)
